intro: Solanum lycioides var. angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved nightshade, is a herbaceous annual plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring erect stems covered in fine hairs. The leaves are lance-shaped, with a narrow, pointed tip, and are often pubescent on the underside. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in umbels, blooming in late summer. The plant produces small, round berries that turn from green to red as they mature, containing toxic compounds.
